H0.text: Deceleration is the term that always refers to acceleration in the direction opposite to the velocity and always reduces speed, unlike negative acceleration.

H1.text: Progression is a term that always refers to acceleration in the direction opposite to velocity and always reduces speed, unlike negative acceleration.

H2.text: Extraction is a term that always refers to acceleration opposite to the direction of velocity and always reduces speed, unlike negative acceleration.

H3.text: Calibration is the term that always refers to acceleration in the direction opposite to the direction of the velocity and always reduces speed, unlike negative acceleration.

A4.text: If the speed of the vehicle decreases, this is an acceleration in the opposite direction of the velocity vector, sometimes called deceleration or retardation

A5.text: Both acceleration and deceleration are treated the same, as they are both changes in velocity
